items.content_html:
Description

This PR adds a small clarification to the expected outcome from one of the exercises without giving away the solution.

Motivation

The exercise eludes to use of the modulo operator to test for divisibility, but the linked guide does not clarify that zero is a positive result for this test and non zero is a negative result. Newcomers, while understanding division, may not understand how this relates to the modulo operator without a prompt as to expected results. Informing them that they should store 0 for even and 1 for odd, combined with the link to the page containing info that includes modulo, should be sufficient for the non mathematically inclined to piece together the method for themselves, without being too easy, or telling them which operator is required.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Clarify expected output in all cases

items.content_html:
Description

I'm concerned that this part of the documentation may mislead readers. The prototype of Object.prototype is null, not undefined. This change should align with the rest of the documentation.

Object.getPrototypeOf(Object.getPrototypeOf(myObject)); // null
// which is
Object.getPrototypeOf(Object.prototype); // null

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: docs: the prototype of Object.prototype is null, not undefined

items.content_html:
Following on from #31453, this PR replaces all remaining rgba()/hsla() occurrences with rgb()/hsl() and updates all remaining rgb()/hsl() occurrences to use the latest syntax, within files\en-us\web

See #30844 for more details on why these changes are being made.

Included in these changes is:

  • Reword api\canvas_api\tutorial\applying_styles_and_colors to use rgb instead of rgba and include a percentage value for alpha, and rename referenced canvas_rgba.png → canvas_rgb.png
  • Remove reference to rgba in html\element\input\color

I have also left some instances of rgba/hsla in mathml\mathcolor, as it lists all the possible ways of using color, including rgb and rgba, new and old syntax, and also accessibility\understanding_color_and_luminance as it is referencing it as legacy syntax.
items.title: Update remaining web area to use latest rgb() and hsl() syntax

items.content_html:
⚠️ This is a draft because the demo doesn’t work with client-side rendered playground yet

Description

Declarative shadow DOM reuses the <template> element for generating shadow root in the presence of the shadowrootmode attribute. This element is no longer for templating only, that needs to be reflected, too.

Motivation

To support existing implementations in Chrome and Safari and prepare for the upcoming Firefox support.

Related issues and pull requests

  • #31102
items.title: Update template element description and add shadowrootmode attribute

items.content_html:
This pull request fixes #29001
It removes the mention of Path=/ requirement from the note in the Partitioned Cookies page.
This PR however leaves that parameter in place when it comes to example right above to keep all options mentioned.

There are no other requirements mentioned for Path=/ in that page.
items.title: Remove Path=/ requirement mentioning from Partitioned Cookies page

items.content_html:
Description

Remove OPTIONS from the example of Access-Control-Allow-Methods.

Motivation

OPTIONS is never actually necessary to my understanding so I think it is a bad example.

Additional details

  • https://www.w3.org/TR/2020/SPSD-cors-20200602/#access-control-allow-methods-response-header
  • https://stackoverflow.com/questions/66926518/should-access-control-allow-methods-include-options

The official spec doesn't explicitly state one way or the other to my knowledge, however it does include examples which do not include OPTIONS.

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Remove OPTIONS from Access-Control-Allow-Methods example

items.content_html:
Description

Add another method to declare color-scheme using HTML meta tag.

Motivation

MDN should provide the reader all the available methods to declare color-scheme. The user will choose which method to use. But the article should list all the methods.

Additional details

Related: #30712
items.title: Declare color-scheme using HTML meta tag

items.content_html:
• pageAction is used to create Address bar button
  • HTML, JavaScript and CSS is not the same (no ESM if I remember correctly)
  • Listening for clicks is in a background script
  • Access to web page DOM is only possible with a content script
  • Link to browser action
  • Link to content scripts

Description

Adds missing information and clarifications.

Motivation

I've created Page Action extension to interact with web page, and then discovered that Page Action code can not do this. Spent quite a lot of time discovering that, so I want to make these changes so that others can save this time.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: pageAction API edits

items.content_html:
Description

In the latest versions of Chrome and Node.js, the maximum string length to my knowledge is 512MB irrespective of 32 vs 64 bit

Motivation

Correct info

Additional details

Me running this code locally in node.js on ubuntu

% node
Welcome to Node.js v20.10.0.
Type ".help" for more information.
> const len = 536_870_889
undefined
> const buf = new Uint8Array(len)
undefined
> for (let i = 0; i < len; i++) {
...   buf[i] = 'a'.charCodeAt(0)
... }

> const str = new TextDecoder().decode(buf)
Uncaught Error: Cannot create a string longer than 0x1fffffe8 characters
    at TextDecoder.decode (node:internal/encoding:449:16) {
  code: 'ERR_STRING_TOO_LONG'
}
> console.log(str.length)
Uncaught ReferenceError: str is not defined
>

in Chrome Version 120.0.6099.129 (Official Build) (64-bit) ubuntu

const len = 536_870_889
const buf = new Uint8Array(len)
for (let i = 0; i < len; i++) {
  buf[i] = 'a'.charCodeAt(0)
}
const str = new TextDecoder().decode(buf)
console.log(str.length)
VM80:7 0

random related thing: i wrote about this awhile back but was notified that the docs here said otherwise https://cmdcolin.github.io/posts/2021-10-30-spooky

Related issues and pull requests

N/A
items.title: Update maximum string length in V8/Node/Chrome

items.content_html:
Description

Remove links to three.js since the engine does not support OVR_multiview2. Support for this extension has been removed with the release r114, see mrdoob/three.js#18750. The mentioned multiview demo webgl_multiple_views renders its views without the extension (so it was never a valid demo).

Motivation

Make sure readers do not assume three.js supports OVR_multiview2.

Additional details

None.

Related issues and pull requests

Relates to mrdoob/three.js#18750
items.title: OVR_multiview2.: three.js demo link
